been playing this game for 1200 hours. Every patch brings new bugs and game breaking mechanics which reduce the overall fun for only the survivor side and are not fixed or managed in any way until the killer population of players complain about them. I will first of all mainly say that this game is enjoyable if you have four friends and even a fifth for kill your friends because that is the only way you wont get facecamped, tunneled, or overall essentially "t-bagged" in front of your mother's grave.  I truly enjoyed this game in the beggining because you could play solo and everyone was on an even field, however due to recent killers and perks added to the game along with their new currency system they have heavily favored killers experience over that of the survivors as well as being mainly in it for the money since feedback from the regular population for this game is overlooked and laughed about. I do not reccomend this game because I have had a more negative experience on this game then i have in any other multiplayer game of this genre in my lifetime. Yes even Evolve had more actual entertainment than this game. I do however still spend my time rotting away in this pitiful hell of a game because sadly enough I have spent so much time and I do enjoy being a completionist so I will prbably be here for awhile longer or until the devs delete this game, which i hope they do.

The game is dying and killers complain about waiting for games but the nerfs to survivor are the reason for having to wait; nobody wants to fucking play survivor it's boring and unfair. Dedicated servers would also help the shitty hitboxes but we all know that will never happen. Hopefully Deathgarden doesn't turn to shit like this game. This game is broken for new players. Dont buy.

I've had this game for almost 2 years, so it's time I wrote a serious review.

TL:DR; This is an incredibly fun (but sometimes equally frustrating) horror themed cat-and-mouse multiplayer game, with a LOT of progression/grinding involved.

Gameplay premise is simple enough: Repair generators, evade the killer as best you can, and escape as survivor. As killer, hunt said survivors and repeatedly place them on sacrificial hooks to kill them before they can repair the generators.

Unfortunately, in my opinion this game doesn't cater very well to new players due to the nature of the progression and perk system. As a new player, you WILL get frustrated with this game when you first start playing as things will happen for seemingly no reason. Perhaps you pick up a survivor as killer, and they immediately escape your grasp. Or as survivor, a killer comes right to your location after placing someone on a hook. Rather than spending hours reading the wiki and memorising what every single perk in the game does (which would help, of course), you can inspect what your teammates and/or opponents' loadouts in the post-game screen. Doing so may answer any questions you had in that match.

And once you've got a few hundred hours (I'm serious) under your belt and have a relative understanding of how this game works, you can start exploring the deeper levels of the game. Perks builds, "techs", "mindgames", and different playstyles.

Survivor gameplay is more open than killer gameplay as there are multiple ways to contribute to a match, and as such allows for a wide range of playstyles. Many perks exist that work well with others and allow for a certain style of play. Want to do nothing but repair generators as fast as possible? There's perks for that. Want to stealth the entire match and be undetected by the killer? There are perks for that. The potential for chase-focused and all-round builds are there too.

Unfortunately, killer gameplay is a bit more restrictive. Of course, you decide what to do and where to go in the match, but depending on the perks or killer you're using, there's not much room for error. Killer gameplay is vastly different to survivor gameplay as every second counts. You've got to keep 4 different players in check, as opposed to having 3 other people on your side as survivor. "Meme" builds are entirely possible on killers, just don't expect to use them and wipe the floor with survivors unless you've got some serious killer experience under your belt.

All in all, it will take quite a few hours (maybe even up to 1000+) before this game gets to a consistently enjoyable level, and even then you will still be frustrated by it.

HOWEVER, it's still my favourite game of all time and I'm glad I put the time I have into it, and continue to do. New content drops every 3 months and they're constantly releasing updates and bug fixes, and are very transparent with the whole process. And what's more, there's quite a large community presence in this game, mainly through Twitch. I you'll meet a lot of new people in this game and I guarantee that some of them will lead to joining communities you'll love.

One last note: You will encounter some majorly toxic people in this game. They'll taunt you, probably get abusive in endgame chat, and generally try to make your life hell. Don't let them ruin the experience for you. Moving straight on (and reporting if needs be) is the best thing you can do.

See you in the fog :)
